result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and PAC Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Kevin J Bednar was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.
  • Kevin J Bednar was found guilty of Hit and Run, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.67(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to pay fine while on probation on Count 2. Defendant is to pay the fine or spend 1 day in jail for each $50 owed for contempt.
Huber for work and treatment including AA meetings.
Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.  Firearm warning given.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
05/29/2015 - PROBATION CORRECTED TO ONE YEAR
Consecutive to: Count 1

miscConds.notes: Pay all court fines and supervision fees. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
No driving unless validly licensed. Comply with counseling, treatment, services and support groups. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Preliminary hearing on August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  No contact with the victim, BW, (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Do not drive unless properly licensed.  You have been ordered to have your fingerprints/photographs taken as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Department Records Bureau. Hours:  Tuesdays, Wednesdays and Thursday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:00 a.m. or between 1:00 p.m. and 3:00 p.m.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Kevin J Bednar in court with attorney Robert William Keller.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Lori Thornton.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
